Description:
Construction Procedure
The Contractor shall submit documented procedures for all construction processes at least fourteen (14) days prior to the commencement of joint installation works and obtain approval from the administrator.
Records:
Procedures
Method statements
Material Test Certificates
Construction Program

Description:
Material conformance - Aluminium extruded Strip
 Approved product complying supplier's technical data sheets and specifications.
 Supplied in modules with the minimum length.
 Holding down arrangements as per specs and drawings.

Material conformance - Neoprene strip seal
 Approved product.
 Seal has to be uniform, homogeneous and without imperfections, surface splits or indentations (reject if not comply).
 Test results (NATA certified) to comply table 5.2.1 of MRTS82
 Test results are not more than six (6) months old.
 Batch details available for production tracking.
 Submission of Neoprene seal test results (Milestone).
Clause:
MRTS82 Cl 6.2.2
MRTS82 Cl 5.2.1
Annexure MRTS82.1 Cl 2

Description:
Material conformance - Studs/Anchor bolts
 Approved product. 
 Minimum stud/bolt diameter shall be M16.
 Bolts shall be fabricated from Grade 316 Stainless Steel.
 Nuts shall be fabricated from Grade 304 Stainless Steel.
 Bolts and nuts shall have coarse pitch metric rolled thread.
 Washers (min 1.5mm thick) shall be fabricated from SS Grade 316.
 All fasteners shall be electro-polished or passivated.

Epoxy Mortar
 Epoxy shall be of an approved product. 
 Approved agent to form dense mortar and provide super adhesion to concrete.
 Fine aggregate - 100% pass through 6.7mm AS sieve and ≥ 85% pass through 4.75mm AS sieve or supplied by epoxy supplier (bagged dry sand or filter medium sand).
 Install during cooler part of the day.
 Mortar shall not be used if the mortar's pot life expired.
 Minimum of 100mm wide mortar shall be maintained on either side of the aluminium strip.

Joint Preparation
 Transverse Saw cut at the outer edge of the EJ (kerb to kerb).
 Saw cut depth less than DWS.
 Remove underlying bond between DWS and deck.
 Sand blast or well scabble the exposed concrete surface
 Remove plugs from socket and insert stud and adjust level.
 Prime the concrete surface using epoxy matching the mortar.
 Prepare epoxy mortar as per manufacturer's recommendation.

Installation - Aluminium extruded Strip
 Drill 18mm dia holes for M16 studs at intervals specified in drawings or as specified by the joint supplier specification.
 Place aluminium protection armour on epoxy mortar. (WP 2)
 Adjust the level to match the profile of deck wearing surface.
 Clean up excessive mortar immediately.
 Tighten the nuts on the studs to the torque after the epoxy has cured as specified by the joint manufacturer's specification. (WP 3)

Installation - Neoprene strip seal
 Install neoprene strip seal between adjoining aluminium sections.
 Continuous length with no intermediate joint(s)
 Seal length is acceptable to suit lane closure arrangement.
 Seal installed using approved lubricant and insertion tool.

Installation - Bolt Channel Fill
 Fill product shall be Class 320 bitumen if not specified complying MRTS17.
 Alternate products - Flexible polyurethane filler or similar approved product.
 Continuous fill without any intermediate joints other than approved joints matching lane closure arrangement.
 Any other gaps shall be filled using epoxy mortar and shall be finished flush with the top of the DWS.

Trafficking on new Joints
Traffic shall not be allowed on newly installed joint until the inspector confirm that the joint installation was undertaken in accordance with the installation procedure.

Handover and Lot Closure
 Cleaning up done
 All Test results received, reviewed and approved
 All NCRs (If applicable) actioned and closed
